messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] You put the lime in the coconut help
messages.msgSnippet: On Sat, 4 Jan 2003 22:24:58 -0500 Stephanie Elms ... If you have RealPlayer you can listen to a snippet at amazon.com. The Coconut was from Nilsson
messages.messageBody:
On Sat, 4 Jan 2003 22:24:58 -0500 "Stephanie Elms"
<stephanie.elms@...> writes:

> Now does anyone know if there is anywhere that I can *hear* this
> over the internet?
> Jason would just absolutely love it I am sure...not sure if I should
> go out and buy
> the cd just for this one song....

If you have RealPlayer you can listen to a snippet at amazon.com.
The Coconut was from Nilsson Schmilsson.
Sorry, I don't know where you could hear the whole song. Did you try
calling your radio station?

Deb L

messages.subject: You put the lime in the coconut help
messages.msgSnippet: I was reading Spider magazine with Jason yesterday and they had a reference to the words you put the lime in the coconut . I remembered enough of the tune to
messages.messageBody:
I was reading Spider magazine with Jason yesterday and they had a reference to the words
"you put the lime in the coconut". I remembered enough of the tune to sing this one
line and he thought that it was just hilarious. I really want to track down the whole
song for him.

I was amazed when I typed "lime in the coconut song" into google and it pulled back pages
of hits LOL! I found out that it was written by Harry Nilsson and re-recorded by the
Baha Men for Reservoir Dogs.

Now does anyone know if there is anywhere that I can *hear* this over the internet?
Jason would just absolutely love it I am sure...not sure if I should go out and buy
the cd just for this one song....

Stephanie E.
